messages.message:
I think we’re going to want OpsGenie to be our source of truth about incidents and on-call moving forward. I’ll have some barebone instructions about for how to do that by end of week (more involved automation will come later).

The main difference is you have to initiate the incident from OpsGenie and specify title and priority there, and from there it will create you a slack channel.
@Heymian that sounds good.  If you can take care of setting up OpsGenie, that will be fantastic.
Just to note OpsGenie is attached to Atlassian and access can be requested through <mailto:ithelp@instabase.com|ithelp@instabase.com>
That said it is an additional seat so let's be mindful to architect alerts through slack and other methods where we can to keep seat allocations at a reasonable level
Oh, that’s interesting @Dave.  I thought that the seat for OpsGenie would be covered under Atlassian :stuck_out_tongue: guess, I was wrong
OpsGenie is an acquisition they sold as a separate product, it's tied into the service desk SKU now
It's all on the same account and they play well together it's just pay to play
It's cheaper than PagerDuty and Blameless for sure, but we want to be mindful to have the view only cases not require licenses through smart tooling and setup if we can
haha, I was about to ping Dave to ask if it was ok to pay for the entire engineering team, and scope out the cost for that.
Currently I only added seats for everyone on the infra on-call rotation, ~30 folks
It would bury most of the savings of we did give it out to everyone, but I would expect that discontinuing the other two will result in a modest increase in seats too

Engineering is getting large and diverse enough in function we generally want to be wary of provisioning to everyone at this point, it's around 150 people depending on if you are referring to the department or the division
division (i think), I don’t think we’ll need 150 seats, i’ll get a better estimate and come ask you for money :slightly_smiling_face:
We don't currently sub divide eng all that much in BambooHR (which is all we can do to anchor on things for privisioning)
Got it, okay, no problem. I’ll do what I can to keep costs/seats down and do things with Jira seats instead of ops-genie.
Yup TL;DR let's continue to be smart about when and how we deploy seats, but it's inevitable we will to some degree
